Text.Value: I just hope we've done enough to take him down.
Ketheric will come to regret his abuse of her powers. I'll make sure of that.
The time is nigh: Ketheric will fall at our hands.
The Nightsong will tear Ketheric to shreds. I wouldn't miss it for the world.
Can't wait to see her cleave Ketheric's head in two.
Ketheric Thorm is vulnerable now. Now is the time to strike.
We must hurry. If she kills Ketheric before we reach Moonrise, I will be sorely disappointed.
Ketheric's vulnerable now. All we have to do is strike.
I... I failed. I let the Nightsong just be taken.

EditorData.NodeContext: In shock/fear of her goddess. SH  has just failed Shar by allowing Nightsong to be taken away

Text.Value: I just hope the old man's true to his word.
A dismal place for an aasimar to spend her existence. Especially with that necrotic toad for company.
Let's hope our choice is to our advantage.
This doesn't sit right with me. I hope I've chosen wisely.
Hope I haven't hitched my wagon to the wrong fuckin' horse.
There shall be dire consequences for this mistake.
I fear we have given up the one advantage we had.
Hopefully this will all be over soon.
Well, she's definitely immortal.
Her death will be temporary, but her anger... that will be permanent.
She didn't speak a lie: The aasimar is immortal.
A light that bright cannot stay quenched.
Oh goody. A pissed off immortal.
Immortal - and angered. What have I done...?
Are we to make a habit of angering immortals and gods?
Well, she wasn't lying - she's immortal.

EditorData.NodeContext:
Karlach: Reacting to Nightsong being killed, who she relates to. She'd be pissed/ sad.
Halsin - shocked

Text.Value: Lady Shar... what will she do to me...?

EditorData.NodeContext: In shock/fear of her goddess. SH  has just defied Shar by not killing Nightsong

Text.Value: I... what have I done?

EditorData.NodeContext: In shock/fear of her goddess. SH  has just defied Shar by not killing Nightsong

Text.Value: Well, she's back with Ketheric.
Better sent to Moonrise than left to rot down here. I hope.
Ketheric has taken the aasimar for his own once more. Perhaps our help will buy us some advantage.
Doomed to suffer. A tragedy many times over.
Hope that wasn't a huge mistake.
I doomed her - and empowered Ketheric Thorm.
That was a mistake. I did not join you to continue my service to Ketheric.
It's done.
What a hellish place to be locked up. It almost makes Cazador feel accommodating.
Nothing more to be done here.
A dire prison for any being...
No point in lingering here.
A terrible contraption by all estimations. All that pain, for the sake of Ketheric's enduring power.
What an awful place to be trapped.
What a wretched place. I should leave.
If we remain in the Shadowfell too long, we will lose ourselves and become hollow.
Such a terrible place. I should leave.

EditorData.NodeContext: SH: resigned (genreric fallback line - Nightsong's fate was not determined)

Text.Value: Almost makes you grateful to have a vampire's immortality. I only had to come back once.
When she resurrects, she'll have no interest in helping me.
She must have been killed a thousand times by now.
By the gone gods, I've made a mistake.
That was a mistake. Damn.
She must have been murdered then brought back, a thousand times - more.
Apologies have never been my strong suit. You do the talking when she awakens.
I wonder how many times she's been killed down here.

EditorData.NodeContext:
Karlach: Reacting to Nightsong being killed, who she relates to. She'd be pissed/ sad.
Halsin - shocked

Text.Value: It is done. Lady Shar has blessed me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Exultant. Arc- SH is loyal to Shar/has just killed Nightsong

Text.Value: But there is more of her work to be done. More of her foes to be cast down.

EditorData.NodeContext: Determined/forward-looking. Exultant. Arc- SH is loyal to Shar/has just killed Nightsong

Text.Value: Lady Shar... what will she do to me...?

EditorData.NodeContext: In shock/fear of her goddess. SH  has just failed Shar by allowing Nightsong to be taken away

Text.Value: Now, that will be a nice surprise for Ketheric.
Finally, the heavens are on my side. Or at least, one very irritated Aasimar.
Dame Aylin is a powerful ally. We did well to free her.
Damn - she's quite something.
Gods... she's incredible.
An aasimar at my side. Few can claim such an ally.
A righteous and furious ally. Impressive.
I've made a powerful ally today.

Synopsis: PAD that plays after the players have finished the Nightsong Rtual situation in the Shadowfell solo
